[[58 Division (Sri Lanka)|58 Division]] | strength2 = | strength3 = | casualties1 = | casualties2 = | casualties3 = | notes = }} {{Campaignbox Eelam War IV}} {{Campaignbox Sri Lankan Civil War}} The '''Battle of Paranthan''' was a military conflict over control of [[Paranthan]], [[Sri Lanka]] between the [[58 Division (Sri Lanka)|58 Division]] of the [[Military of Sri Lanka|Sri Lankan Military]] and the [[Liberation Tigers of Tamil Eelam]] (LTTE) as an engagement of the [[Northern Theater of Eelam War IV|Northern Theater]] of [[Eelam War IV]] during the [[Sri Lankan civil war]]. Fought from December 30, 2008 to January 1, 2009, the Army announced on the January 1 that it had claimed the land.{{cite news | url = http://www.hindu.com/2009/01/02/stories/2009010255511300.htm title = Paranthan captured: Army | last = Reddy | first = B. Muralidhar | date = 2009-01-02 | work = The Hindu | accessdate = 2009-06-11}} The Army indicated that it had previously claimed the town in September 1996 during the campaign of [[Sathjaya I]] and [[Sathjaya II]], but had withdrawn for [[tactical withdrawal|tactical]] reason in September 1998.{{cite web | url = http://www.lankaenews.com/English/news.php?id=6908 | title = SL Army captured Paranthan LTTE garrison | publisher = Sri Lankan Ministry of Decence | date = 2009-01-01 | accessdate = 2009-06-11}} == References == {{coord missing|Sri Lanka}} [[Category:Eelam War IV]] [[Category:Conflicts in 2008]] [[Category:Conflicts in 2009]] [[Category:2008 in Sri Lanka]] [[Category:2009 in Sri Lanka]] [[Category:Battles of the Sri Lankan Civil War]]
